channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Investors can’t afford to ignore the stagflation threat shadowing the market
item.description: Don’t get caught napping by the potential for renewed inflation pressures as the economy slows, warns a top Wall Street economist.

item.title: It’s a new era of central bank dissent — and with a whiff of stagflation in the air, that’s not likely to change
item.description: It’s an era of unprecedented central bank dissension — and agreement is hard to find when the goals are in conflict.

item.title: FORT Robotics adds $18.9M to Series B funding for robotic safety
item.description: FORT Robotics plans to use its latest funding to continue innovating in safety for robotics and physical AI. The post FORT Robotics adds $18.9M to Ser...

item.title: Lyft partners with Baidu to deploy autonomous vehicles in Europe
item.description: Lyft plans to deploy Baidu Apollo Go's RT6 robotaxis in Germany and the U.K. starting next year, pending regulatory approvals. The post Lyft partners ...

item.title: Help! I need $80K to buy my husband out of our home. Do I raid my $180K Roth IRA?
item.description: “I have two young children, and I have a great mortgage rate.”

item.title: The Download: how AI is improving itself, and hidden greenhouse gases
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. Five ways th...

item.title: Eli Lilly’s weight-loss pill didn’t work so well, and the stock is plunging
item.description: Lilly’s stock was tumbling as disappointing trial data for an oral weight-loss pill offset an upbeat earnings report and outlook.

item.title: Stock buybacks are surging — and that’s why you should be careful in this market
item.description: This year’s record-setting pace of share buybacks is bearish.

item.title: The greenhouse gases we’re not accounting for
item.description: In the spring of 2021, climate scientists were stumped. The global economy was just emerging from the covid-19 lockdowns, but for some reason the leve...

item.title: Google’s new diffusion AI agent mimics human writing to improve enterprise research
item.description: A diffusion model inspired by the human process of drafting, searching for information, and making iterative revisions.

item.title: The Download: OpenAI’s open-weight models, and the future of internet search
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. OpenAI has f...

item.title: How a ‘vibe working’ approach at Genspark tripled ARR growth and supported a barrage of new products and features in just weeks
item.description: AI-native working allows Genspark to work at “gen speed” and release new products and features nearly every week.

item.title: New ‘persona vectors’ from Anthropic let you decode and direct an LLM’s personality
item.description: A new study from Anthropic introduces "persona vectors," a technique for developers to monitor, predict and control unwanted LLM behaviors.

item.title: Optimized components expand motion possibilities for humanoid robots
item.description: Advanced motion components tailored for precision, control and reliability help humanoid robots excel at their work. The post Optimized components exp...

item.title: For regulated industries, AWS’s neurosymbolic AI promises safe, explainable agent automation
item.description: AWS is making automated reasoning checks, a feature on Bedrock, generally available to customers to start proving truth in their AI systems.

item.title: Learn at RoboBusiness how Sim2Real is training robots for the real world
item.description: A key RoboBusiness session on physical AI will feature Ambi Robotics’ PRIME-1 foundation model as a case study. The post Learn at RoboBusiness how Sim...

item.title: The initial reactions to OpenAI’s landmark open source gpt-oss models are highly varied and mixed
item.description: The verdict, for now, is split. OpenAI’s gpt-oss models are a landmark in terms of licensing and accessibility.

item.title: PrismaX launches teleop platform for robotic arms
item.description: In the future, PrismaX said its teleoperation platform will enable access to a variety of humanoid robots. The post PrismaX launches teleop platform f...

item.title: Five ways that AI is learning to improve itself
item.description: Last week, Mark Zuckerberg declared that Meta is aiming to achieve smarter-than-human AI. He seems to have a recipe for achieving that goal, and the f...

item.title: OpenAI has finally released open-weight language models
item.description: OpenAI has finally released its first open-weight large language models since 2019’s GPT-2. These new “gpt-oss” models are available in two different ...
